interaction_summary:
=== Purchase Information ===
Product Title: Working Girl
Review Date: 2006/06/06
Store: Melanie Griffith  (Actor),     Harrison Ford  (Actor),     Mike Nichols  (Director)    &                   0                  more   Rated:    R    Format: DVD
Categories: Movies & TV, Studio Specials, 20th Century Fox Home Entertainment, All Fox Titles
Product Description: ["Nominated for 6 Academy Awards; director Mike Nichols' witty, romantic look at life in the corporate jungle stars Melanie Griffith as Tess McGill, an ambitious secretary with a unique approach for climbing the ladder to success. When her classy, but villainous boss (Sigourneey Weaver) Breaks a leg skiing, Tess simply takes over her office, her apartment, even her wardrobe. She then creates a deal with a handsome investment banker (Harrison Ford) that will either take her straight to the top - or finish her off for good."]
Average Rating: 4.7
Product Details: {'Aspect Ratio': '1.85:1', 'Is Discontinued By Manufacturer': 'No', 'MPAA rating': 'R (Restricted)', 'Product Dimensions': '7.5 x 5.5 x 0.53 inches; 2.08 Ounces', 'Director': 'Mike Nichols', 'Media Format': 'Multiple Formats, Anamorphic, Closed-captioned, Color, Dolby, Widescreen, NTSC', 'Run time': '1 hour and 53 minutes', 'Release date': 'April 17, 2001', 'Actors': 'Melanie Griffith, Harrison Ford, Sigourney Weaver, Alec Baldwin, Joan Cusack', 'Subtitles': 'English, Spanish', 'Language': 'French (Dolby Digital 2.0 Surround), English (Dolby Digital 2.0 Surround), English (Dolby Digital 3.0)', 'Studio': '20th Century Fox', 'Writers': 'Kevin Wade', 'Number of discs': '1'}
Review Text: For a general review of this fun movie please read other excellent reviews.  I would love to own the DVD.  But where can I purchase a cut version?  I prefer NOT to watch Alec Baldwin "bopping" Doreen. Or Kevin Spacey attempting "seduction??" by showing a porn film to Griffith.  Nor listen to Griffith remind herself not to F--- Up repeatedly.  Classy lady with foul mouth moves up the corporate ladder.  Nichols attempt to seek a R rating is just plain stupid.  This otherwise wonderful film is ruined by this mess.  To enjoy Working Girl at its best I will watch the TV version.
Review Title: Gratuitous nudity, foul language & vulgarities
Rating: 4.0
--------------------------------------------------
reference_summary:
Remington Steele: Season 1 Stephanie Zimbalist (Actor), Pierce Brosnan (Actor), Burt Brinckerhoff (Director), Don Weis (Director) & 1 more Rated: Unrated Format: DVD Movies & TV, Studio Specials, 20th Century Fox Home Entertainment, Action, General ['Product Description', 'Before he was Bond... he was Remington Steele...Private eye Laura Holt (Stephanie Zimbalist) grudgingly accepts a new partner when a mystery man (Pierce Brosnan) assumes the identity of her fictitious boss, Remington Steele. Together, the two battle crime as as their feelings for each other.', 'Amazon.com', 'Remington Steele', "'s fusion of whodunit mystery and screwball comedy burst onto television in 1982. After struggling to get clients to hire a female detective, Laura Holt (sultry Stephanie Zimbalist) invents a fictional boss named Remington Steele, whose dashing manly name draws in work. But while protecting some South African jewels, Holt runs across a mysterious thief and con-man (an elfin, baby-faced Pierce Brosnan) whom her client assumes is the nonexistent Steele--and when the case is resolved, the accidental detective decides he likes the work and sticks around, infuriating Holt with his arrogant ways and tantalizing her with his dashing good looks. Murders may occur at a winery, an island sex club, or a college reunion, but just about every episode plunders plot elements from classic movies like", 'Bringing Up Baby', ',', 'The Third Man', ', and', 'The Trouble with Harry', "(even the theme song was written by film composer Henry Mancini). The writers openly acknowledge this influence by having Steele use ideas he's lifted from movies to solve crimes. The constant allusions to old films should be annoying, but the show demonstrates such a rich affection for the classics that these tips of the hat actually mesh with", 'Remington Steele', "'s world.", 'Remington Steele', "has become best known as Brosnan's launching pad (he later become James Bond in", 'GoldenEye', "and its sequels), but Zimbalist was every bit as crucial to the show's success; her mixture of glamor and toughness gives the show a distinctly adult sexiness and grounds Brosnan's boyish charm. The dialogue sometimes slipped from arch camp to sheer cheese, but even at its most ridiculous (say, a scene where Holt and Steele question homeless bums while dressed in formal evening wear)", 'Remington Steele', "remains an eminently watchable show, thanks to zippy plotting and the chemistry between Zimbalist and Brosnan. Some episodes clearly implied that the pair had become intimate, yet that didn't defuse their attraction. Even when the stories became a bit silly, the mutual respect and desire between Holt and Steele never lost its sophistication.", '--Bret Fetzer'] {'Aspect Ratio': '1.33:1', 'Is Discontinued By Manufacturer': 'No', 'MPAA rating': 'Unrated (Not Rated)', 'Product Dimensions': '7.5 x 5.5 x 0.5 inches; 6.4 Ounces', 'Director': 'Burt Brinckerhoff, Don Weis, Jeff Bleckner, Larry Elikann, Leo Penn', 'Media Format': 'Multiple Formats, Closed-captioned, Color, Dolby, Dubbed, NTSC, Subtitled, Full Screen', 'Run time': '17 hours and 58 minutes', 'Release date': 'July 26, 2005', 'Actors': 'Stephanie Zimbalist, Pierce Brosnan, James Read, Janet DeMay, Carlene Watkins', 'Dubbed': 'English', 'Subtitles': 'English, Spanish', 'Language': 'Unqualified, English (Dolby Digital 1.0)', 'Studio': '20th Century Fox', 'Number of discs': '4'} WHAT IS WITH THE COVER?? Shouldn't this be a black background with lip print, gun and such. (As in the beginning of later episodes) Stephanie Zimbalist was excellent in this series. Why is she ignored? Worse yet, what is with the "Bond" reference. If "she" didn't have a deep dark secret would Brosnan be necessary?????

Hey, don't get me wrong. I watched it for ...his blue eyes and mysterious past.... Another deep dark secret......... Working Girl Melanie Griffith (Actor), Harrison Ford (Actor), Mike Nichols (Director) & 0 more Rated: R Format: DVD Movies & TV, Studio Specials, 20th Century Fox Home Entertainment, All Fox Titles ["Nominated for 6 Academy Awards; director Mike Nichols' witty, romantic look at life in the corporate jungle stars Melanie Griffith as Tess McGill, an ambitious secretary with a unique approach for climbing the ladder to success. I would love to own the DVD. But where can I purchase a cut version? I prefer NOT to watch Alec Baldwin "bopping" Doreen. Or Kevin Spacey attempting "seduction??" by showing a porn film to Griffith. Nor listen to Griffith remind herself not to F--- Up repeatedly. Classy lady with foul mouth moves up the corporate ladder. Nichols attempt to seek a R rating is just plain stupid. profile:
**Updated User Profile Summary:**

- **Interests:** The user continues to enjoy classic TV series and films that blend mystery and romance, particularly featuring strong female leads and charismatic male counterparts. They remain fond of clever dialogue and strong character dynamics, reflecting a consistent preference for narratives with emotional depth.

- **Notable Preferences:** The user’s appreciation for specific actors extends to Melanie Griffith and Harrison Ford, reinforcing their interest in performances that highlight character evolution amidst playful tension. They exhibit a discerning taste in narratives, especially those involving ambitious female characters navigating challenging environments.

- **Ratings and Feedback Patterns:** The user maintains high ratings for content that resonates emotionally, now indicating a nuanced critique of explicit content, suggesting a desire for authenticity and a focus on character integrity. Their feedback reveals a preference for edited versions of films to avoid unnecessary vulgarity while still appreciating the story.

- **Themes and Elements Valued:** They value strong character portrayals, romantic subplots, and a blend of comedy with serious undertones, emphasizing a love for storytelling that honors cinematic traditions without sacrificing engagement. The user's critical lens towards inappropriate content highlights their sensitivity to the portrayal of femininity and professionalism in storytelling.

Overall, the user's interests reflect a continued appreciation for character-driven narratives that balance drama and wit while favoring authenticity over gratuitous elements.
